message.content:
cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.DM, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with characterizing tractable fragments of the constraint satisfaction problem (CSP), which is a fundamental problem in artificial intelligence and theoretical computer science. The use of forbidden patterns to define CSP fragments is a common approach in the field. The paper specifically focuses on partially-ordered forbidden patterns and their relationship with arc consistency, a reduction operation used in constraint solvers. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), followed by cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). The paper also involves some combinatorial aspects, which suggest cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity) as possible sub-categories.
